roleset.name: transfer
roleset.note: GIVE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls give-13.1-1. Nominal 'giving' based on BOLT-6. (from give.01-v)
GIVING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from giving.01-n)

example.name: give-v: double object
example.text: The executives gave the chefs a standing ovation.

example.name: give-v: ditransitive
example.text: She had given the answers to two low-ability geography classes.
example.arg: to two low ability geography classes

example.name: give-v: give way
example.text: The Beatles give way to baseball in the Nipponese version.

example.name: give-v: Odd discourse-level usage
example.text: This is very odd, *trace* given uncertainties about the auction.

example.name: give-v: another discourse-level usage
example.text: Given the weakness in both the junk bond market and the stock market, traders fear that these transactions may be revised yetagain.
example.arg: the weakness in both the junk bond market and the stock market

example.name: giving-n
example.text: Gift - giving is also a technical job

roleset.name: to be likely to, given to
roleset.note: GIVE-V NOTES: Roleset based on instance in ULA-MASC1-rest. Framed by Claire. No relevant VN entry. (from give.14-v)

role.descr: Person entity likely to do/be a certain way
Thing which arg1 is likely to do/be

example.name: give-j: All arguments
example.text: As the pyramids were already about 2500 years old when Diodorus wrote his World History , one is given to wonder what his authority might have been for such a vivid description .
example.arg: to wonder what his authority might have been for such a vivid description.

roleset.name: idiomatic: to care (give a crap, etc)
roleset.note: GIVE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from give.16-v)

example.name: give-v: give a shit
example.text: I 've been threatened physically twice .... like I give a shit ....

example.name: all args
example.text: I mean you do n't really think that any of these guys really give a shit about their party or their nation , do ya ?
example.arg: about their party of their nation

example.name: any synonym for excrement will do...
example.text: Plus , you have to find 250 students who-1 *PRO*-1 even pay attention to the student council , and give enough of a poo poo todo something about it .
example.arg: enough of a poo poo to do something about it

roleset.name: yield when pressure is applied
roleset.note: GIVE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from give.17-v)

example.name: both args
example.text: He is hoping your arm is going to drop off and you-1 are going *-1 to give to the pressure of his pulling
example.arg: to the pressure of his pulling

example.name: Standard
example.text: People just have to accept that something must give .

roleset.name: give away: transfer
roleset.note: GIVE_AWAY-V NOTES: See VNcls give-13.1-1. (from give.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: They sometimes give away a few exact questions and answers
example.arg: a few exact questions and answers

example.name: another transitive
example.text: Hearst might have virtually given the paper away

roleset.name: reveal what something really is
roleset.note: GIVE_AWAY-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in ON-miss (from give.15-v)

roles.note: No arg2 seen in survey, but seems possible. Be careful to distinguish from usages where there is the transfer of a person e.g. "They gave him away to the police"...use context as best you can to distinguish. (from give.15-v)

role.descr: what arg1 is revealed to be, true state itself

example.name: Args 0 & 1 only
example.text: The street signs around here give the game away - La Rue de la Grande Truanderie - "the street of great criminality", is still home to evil-looking dope-dealers.

example.name: Args 0, 1, 3
example.text: But he gave himself away as a hoodlum with his attempts to impress us with his inside knowledge of drug-dealing and stickups.
example.arg: with his attempts to impress us with his inside knowledge of drug-dealing and stickups

roleset.name: give back: return
roleset.note: GIVE_BACK-V NOTES: See VNcls give-13.1-1. (from give.03-v)

example.name: gimme gimme
example.text: Stocks gave back some of their gains.

example.name: emit
example.text: This radiator gives off a lot of heat.

example.name: die
example.text: John's old truck finally gave out.

roleset.name: give out: distribute
roleset.note: GIVE_OUT-V NOTES: See VNcls give-13.1-1. (from give.06-v)

example.name: distribute
example.text: John gives out lots of candy on Halloween to the kids on his block.
example.arg: to the kids on his block

example.name: no project mentioned
example.text: John gave up after trying for a week.

example.name: explicit project
example.text: John gave up on the puzzle.

example.name: somewhat idiomatic
example.text: John's old truck gave up the ghost.

roleset.name: give up: surrender
roleset.note: GIVE_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls give-13.1-1. (from give.08-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: Insurers-3 buy this insurance protection for themselves by [*-3]giving up a portion of the premiums they collect on a policy to another firm -- a reinsurance company, which, in turn, accepts a portion of any losses resulting from this policy.
example.arg: a portion of the premiums they collect on a policy
to another firm -- a reinsurance company, which, in turn, accepts a portion of any losses resulting from this policy

roleset.name: give in: yield
roleset.note: GIVE_IN-V NOTES: Member of VNcls acquiesce-95. (from give.09-v)

example.name: wimps
example.text: Ms. Bartlett told her audience that she-1 absolutely did not believe in compromise or in [*]-1 giving in to the client ``because I don't think you can do watered-down versions of things.''

example.name: without mention of winner
example.text: Finally, of course, the boss gives in, but he's still yelling: ``I find myself explaining anything to Teddy Kennedy, you'll be chasing stolen cars in Anchorage.''
The crisis of national survival forced them to a deeply critical self-examination which *T*-2 gave rise to several self-awareness campaigns over the following decades.

roleset.name: transfer
roleset.note: GIVE_OVER-V NOTES: No VNcls. (although give-13.1-1 almost fits). (from give.13-v)

example.name: no subject
example.text: Twenty-some years ago more than 2200 hectares of land around Muening was given *T*-9 over to the cultivation of tobacco.
